Kondou and Hijikata and a couple other Shinsengumi were poets however
findi=
ng their death poems is a bit difficult.

In the case of Hijikata, in 

Hil=
lsborough, Romulus. Shinsengumi The Shogun's Last Samurai Corps.
Tokyo: Tut=
tle Publishing, 2005. 
ISBN 0804836272 (there are used copies around you ca=
n buy, currently
this is the only book in English on the Shinsengumi)

on p=
age 173

"Though my body may decay on the island of Ezo,
My spirit guards m=
y lord in the east."

Hillsborough and others (Japanese websites) have stat=
ed that
"Hijikata's lord in the east was none other than the last shogun,
T=
okugawa Yoshinobu" (Hillborough 173).

you may want to try searching for ot=
her death poems (not yet
translated) by trying the major sites listed here:=

http://www.shinsengumihq.com/links.htm
please use the online translators (=
which can only give you an "idea"
of the meaning) listed at the top of the =
page

please feel free to share with us what you find too!  (^_^)
